DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Specific Distress Questionnaire Past Week How Frequently True Have Trouble Falling Asleep or Staying Asleep Score Assessment of Distress Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation, in the past seven days, of how frequently have trouble falling asleep or staying asleep , using Assessment of Distress Scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Specific Distress Questionnaire Past Week How Frequently True Have Trouble Falling Asleep or Staying Asleep Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Clearly and explicitly stated._A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures._A predetermined set of questions.:The most recent week. May include the present day._A question asking an individual how frequently something was true for them._A question about whether an individual had or has trouble falling asleep or staying asleep because of pictures or thoughts about the event that came to their mind._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Clearly and explicitly stated._A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures._A predetermined set of questions.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.

Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day.:A question asking an individual how frequently something was true for them.:A question about whether an individual had or has trouble falling asleep or staying asleep because of pictures or thoughts about the event that came to their mind.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question asking an individual how frequently something was true for them.

Concepts.longName: Have Trouble Falling Asleep or Staying Asleep
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual had or has trouble falling asleep or staying asleep because of pictures or thoughts about the event that came to their mind.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: IES:Impact of Event Scale; M. Horowitz et al., Impact of Event Scale: A measure of subjective stress. 1979, Psychosomatic Med 41, 209-218

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of determining, usually through interviews and observation, the status of an individual's distress._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: I had trouble falling asleep or staying sleep, because of pictures or thoughts about it that came into my mind
